natural.title: True Color Composite
natural.description: Uses visible light bands in red, green, and blue channels, showing Earth as humans would naturally see it. Great for distinguishing clouds, land, vegetation, and water bodies.

ndvi.title: Vegetation Index (NDVI)
ndvi.description: The Normalized Difference Vegetation Index (NDVI) measures vegetation greenness by comparing how plants reflect visible and near-infrared light. Values range from –1 to +1, where values below –0.5 indicate water, –0.5 to 0 represent barren areas like rock or sand, 0 to 0.2 indicate very sparse vegetation, 0.2 to 0.6 represent shrubs and grassland, and values above 0.6 indicate dense, healthy vegetation.

moisture.title: Moisture Index (NDMI)
moisture.description: The Normalized Difference Moisture Index (NDMI) measures vegetation water content using reflected near-infrared and shortwave infrared light. Values range from –1 to +1, where values below –0.2 indicate dry or barren soil, 0 to 0.4 suggests vegetation under water stress, and values above 0.4 represent healthy vegetation with higher moisture content.

urban.title: Urban Areas
urban.description: False color urban composite highlights built-up areas in white/grey/purple. Vegetation appears in green, soils in various colors. Water shown as black/blue, and burned areas or active fires in red/yellow.

about.title: About Water Wise
about.subtitle: A Geospatial Platform for Intelligent Water Management
about.description: Water Wise is a web application developed as part of the Final Year Project in Computer Engineering at Universidade Lusófona. The platform aims to support efficient water resource management, focusing on reservoirs, rivers, and agricultural zones.

mission.title: Mission
mission.description: To provide an integrated, visual, and predictive overview of the current hydrological situation, collecting and integrating real-time and historical data to support sustainable water management.
